review_title: Great place to work full of possibilities
pros:
I have worked at seeability for 4 months now, it is an exceptional place to work, with a real focus on being person centred. I am well supported by my management and the team had such a welcoming approach. I was interviewed by family of the people we support as well as directors and regional managers. 
I instantly clicked with the people who love there and feel there is no other place i would rather work. Such a joy to feel like work is more of a hobby than a chore. In the last month alone I have had the pleasure of seeing the people we support enjoy holidays, parties, BBQs and so much more. 
The team makes me feel like I have a second home and hope more committed caring individuals will join our team to further our support.
cons: As any other care company, many people are working hard to continuously improve standards and I trust this will continue.

review_title: Loved working with the staff and people we cared for
pros: Good team Hard working Brilliant line managet Average salary but did overtime
cons: Some people talked about you behind your back but on the whole ignore that and it was really, really rewarding

job_title: People Support Assistant in London, England
pros: You learn a lot, but if you are not amongst managers' favourites you will not be treated well.
cons: Lack of socialising and low payment.

job_title: Deputy Manager in Ashford, Kent, South East England, England
pros: Pay and bonus and the job
cons: On call. Lack of support and mental health

pros: Great people to work with and good salary
Good working environment and helpful co-workers
cons: Awkward shift hours but expected with care assistant roles

review_title: Sad it's not as good as it could be
job_title: Support Worker in Wellington, South West England, England
pros: The individuals we look after are lovely.
cons: Hours are long, short staff most times and very clicky with each other

review_title: A company that doesn't practice what it preaches!
cons: Be prepared to wear a knife vest, as you Will be stabbed in the back.

pros:
Excellent induction and training package
Friendly staff team 
Routes to progress
cons: It’s hard to find cons in a job you enjoy!

pros:
Residents are wonderful
Manager is supportive
Good training
cons:
Poor pay - for what the staff do, they are grossly underpaid and unappreciated by higher management who are clearly very out of the loop and have no idea what it's like to be a carer!
The people who pay you, payroll, are clearly not cut out for the job.

pros: Management are never there and don't really care so there's no one breathing down your neck.
cons: Management are useless, they don't care about your wellbeing, extremely sexest environment.
